text.text_translated:
The Hunger Games are an annual event.  
The Capitol uses this event to punish the districts.  
It reminds the districts that they rebelled.  
Every year the Capitol chooses one boy and one girl by lottery.  
They come from each district.  
They are 12 to 18 years old.  
These chosen teenagers are called tributes.  
The tributes must fight until only one person survives.  
The whole country must watch on television.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Vocabulary Audit Failure. The text uses B1 level words that are not allowed at A2 level: 'annual', 'punish', 'districts', 'lottery'. Suggestion: Change 'The Hunger Games are an annual event.' to 'The Hunger Games happen every year.' Suggestion: Replace 'uses this event to punish the districts.' with 'uses this event to show the areas are in trouble.' Suggestion: Replace 'chooses one boy and one girl by lottery' with 'chooses one boy and one girl by a random draw.'

best_attempt.text_translated:
The Hunger Games are an annual event on television.  
The Capitol uses this event to punish districts for rebelling.  
Every year one boy and one girl are chosen.  
They are chosen from each district by lottery.  
The chosen teenagers are ‘tributes’.  
A ‘tribute’ is a chosen teenager.  
The tributes fight until only one is alive.  
The whole country must watch the games on television.
